alert.note: Alert for Spencer (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 1:46AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Local wind gusts of 35 to 45 mph expected with bands of showers and isolated thunderstorms through 6 am CST... Bands of moderate to heavy rain showers, as well as a few thunderstorms, will continue to work across the area overnight. Gusty winds, occasionally gusting between 35 and 45 mph, may be associated with some of the downpours of rain. For travelers, the combination of rain and wind may reduce visibility on the road ahead, as well as buffet the vehicle you are driving. This may be problematic for those drivers of high profile vehicles, such as tractor trailers. The gusty winds will also toss around unsecured objects left outdoors. With the moist ground, the gusty winds and rain may also topple weak or diseased trees or break off small branches. Should any of these branches hit power lines, a brief power outage may result. The majority of the wind gusts are expected to occur across west Kentucky and parts of southwest Indiana, along and south of a Paducah Kentucky to Rockport Indiana line. These gusty winds should gradually subside across this area before 6 am CST Sunday.
